div.sent: We have learned that the main teaching of the Ten Commandments is love.
The Ten Commandments are divided into two parts.
In the first part we discussed about how we can express our love for God.
From the commandments in the second part we will learn about how we can express our love for man.
The following commandments are included in the second part of the Ten Commandments of God.
Catholic Community Other Christian Communit ies You shall worship the Lord your God and Him alone.
I am the Lord your God.
You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain.
You shall not have strange gods before me.
You shall observe Sunday as the day of rest and keep it holy.
You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain.
Observe the Sabbath day, to keep it holy.
Our parents have given us birth.
Our mother suffered much at the time of delivery.
Our mother has nurtured us by breast- feeding.
It is hard to explain how much work our parents do for us.
They provide us with food, clothes, shelter, education etc.
We are raised by their love, care and nursing.
In this way we grow up physically and mentally.
We should know what our parents want and what they don't want.
We should do what they tell us to do.
We should not do what they forbid us to do.
We should always be obedient to them.
We must look after them when they face hard times.
We are born from the womb of our mother.
As living beings we can enjoy life; we eat, drink and study.
Every day we can gather new experiences.
But when God calls us, we have to go back to Him.
God has given us this life.
The master of our life is God, the Lord.
God has not given us the right to kill anyone.
Anyone who kills a man or a woman is a great sinner.
God has created man as male and female.
He has given both of them equal dignity as human persons.
We should not watch indecent things and pictures.
We should not use abusive language, entertain bad thoughts and read bad books and magazines.
We should love other boys or girls as our friends.
We should always put on elegant and decent dress.
We should be sincere in talking, deeds and behavior.
To take away someone's things or property without permission is called theft.
We should not steal others money or any other thing.
If we borrow a thing from anybody, we should return it to him.
If we find anything lost by someone, we should return it to the owner.
We should not use anything without the owner's knowledge.
We should not deceive anybody.
We should pay back everyone's dues.
We should not squander away money or time.
We should not adopt unfair means in the examinations because this is also same as stealing.
Words and deeds which cause damage or harm to anyone are considered false witness.
Our words and deeds should be such that edify others.
We should not make any false statements or tell any lies against others.
We are body, mind and soul.
Sometimes our body and mind lead us to temptation.
So we should be always careful about what we do or say.
We will not look at others with bad intention, evil thought and evil eye.
We will not do anything disgraceful to others or tempt them to do something shameful.
When we are greedy, we feel tempted to take it.
Then we steal it or take it away illegally.
We have learned about the Ten Commandments of God.
He has given us these commandments in order to help us to love God and human beings more sincerely.
Then we do things that are against love, that is to say, we hurt others and hurt ourselves.
We fail to give importance to God Who created us.
Thus we commit sin.
As a result we become unhappy and make others unhappy.
And as a result of our sin, we are deprived of God's love.
In heaven we will spend our life with God in happiness.
But if we commit sin, we cannot attain happiness.
Those who die at the state of serious sin, will go to hell.
There they will suffer for ever.
Prayer: O God, teach not to be greedy, not to covet my neighbor's goods and property.
Help me to be aware of the needs of others, especially of the poor.
May I be inspired to help to the poor out of what I own.
